ModMetaData.name: Celsius
ModMetaData.author: Garwel
ModMetaData.description:
Celsius adds realistic simulation of thermodynamics to the game:
- Cell-accurate temperature simulation(as opposed to vanilla's room-level abstraction). Geysers and fires warm surrounding air, mountains and large bodies of water keep a more constant temperature etc.
- Freezing and melting. Rivers, seas and marshes may turn into icy plains in the winter and melt again in the summer. Setting up fires on glaciers can uncover water or ground underneath. Be careful, so that your pawns don't drown in deep water.
- Autoignition of flammable things when it gets very hot.
- Weather effects: wetness, wind and direct sunlight affect pawns' perceived temperature (i.e. comfortable temperature range); rain melts snow quicker.
